headline: Charter Mobile, Video Growth Offsets Internet Subscriber Declines
summary: The company’s total mobile lines rose by 428,000 and total video customers rose 44,000, helping to counteract the impact of increased competition from fixed wireless and fiber connections on its internet business.

summary: Charter Communications, Inc. (NASDAQ:CHTR) ranks among the most promising QQQ stocks according to hedge funds. headline: Charter Communications sheds fewer broadband subscribers than expected
summary: Charter Communications reported a smaller-than-expected decline in broadband subscribers for the fourth quarter on ​Friday, helped by its internet offerings that can ‌be bundled with high-speed mobile services.  The broadband and cable TV provider has benefited from customizable bundles that package internet, TV and phone services into a single offering.  Charter lost 119,000 ​internet customers in the fourth quarter, lower than an ‌expected decrease of 131,970, according to 16 analysts polled by Visible Alpha.

headline: Charter Revenue Hurt by Declines in Internet Subscriber Volumes
summary: Charter Communications reported lower fourth-quarter revenue, hurt by lower political advertising income, and posted continued declines in internet subscribers amid increased competition from fixed wireless and fiber connections.

headline: Charter (NASDAQ:CHTR) Misses Q4 CY2025 Sales Expectations, But Stock Soars 6%
summary: Cable, internet, and telephone services provider Charter (NASDAQ:CHTR) missed Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q4 CY2025, with sales falling 2.3% year on year to $13.6 billion. Its GAAP profit of $10.34 per share was 3.3% above analysts’ consensus estimates.
